result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thuang Kip Thang

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thuang Kip Thang in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Thuang Kip Thang.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter:  Sang Chin Par.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Sworn as Hakka Chin interpreter: Sang Chin Par

Defendant Thuang Kip Thang in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Thuang Kip Thang appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and Filed:  Order Appointing Counsel at County Expense

Defendant Thuang Kip Thang in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Sang Chin Par. 
Case in court following case #21CF3497.  Attorney Plaisted is court appointed on defendant's lower pending felony matter.  Defendant is eligible for public defender representation on this matter.  Court appoints Attorney Michael Plaisted who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Court orders defendant to repay the County $60.00 total upon completion of the case.  Attorney Plaisted is not available for the scheduled preliminary hearing date of 8-17-2022.  Court adjourned preliminary hearing for CAUSE and set a new date. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 08-05-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 07-27-2022

Defendant Thuang Kip Thang not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. States requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  
Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Thuang Kip Thang in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Thuang Kip Thang in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thuang Kip Thang appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defendant is advised due to the defendant's lower pending matter, this case is re-tabbed to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter: Sang Chin Par.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
